The Chapter with Bhaddāli
The Elder Nāgapallava’s Birth Story
“In the city of Bandhumatī,
I lived in the king’s pleasure park.
Next to my hermitage,
the leader of the world sat down.
Taking a nāgapallava,
I offered it to the Buddha.
With a confident mind and a happy mind,
I paid homage to the Fortunate One.
For ninety-one eons,🔽I worshipped the nāgapallava.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements have been burnt up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Nāgapallava recited these verses.
